com.davidbracewell.hermes

Class Document

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.davidbracewell.hermes.Span
      • com.davidbracewell.hermes.HString
        • com.davidbracewell.hermes.Document
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AnnotatedObject, AttributedObject, RelationalObject, Serializable, CharSequence, Comparable<Span>

    public class Document
extends HString

    The document is the central object class in the TIPSTER architecture. It serves as repository for Attributes and Annotations. In the TIPSTER architecture a document is part of one or more collections and can only be accessed as a member of that collection. In this architecture the document is independent of the collection, but can be linked back to the collection through an Attribute.

    Documents are not normally constructed directly, instead they are built through the DocumentFactory which takes care of normalizing and parsing the underlying text. Pre-tokenized text can be converted into a document using the DocumentFactory.fromTokens(Iterable) method.

    Author:
    David B. Bracewell
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
